bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Ellen M. O'Connor, 9 November [1875]
bibl.orgName: The Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature, New York Public Library

revisionDesc.change: extracted transcription from Major Authors cd

body.p: I am in Washington, stopping at Mr. & Mrs. Nash's, L st. south east, Navy Yard—am middling well, for me—shall be in pretty sure up to 10 a.m. & from 2 to 3 p.m. Am so fixed that it is very convenient for my friends to call—Love to you.
